alert.note: Alert for Greer; Jackson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 6:33PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Salt Fork Red River near Mangum affecting Jackson and Greer Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Salt Fork Red River near Mangum. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding of agricultural bottomlands and isolation of other low-lying areas in Harmon... Greer... and Jackson counties. No towns or highways are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 8.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 5.2 feet Monday morning. It will rise to 5.4 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 645 AM CDT.
